name: XVerExtensionPlanDefinition.goal
title: Cross-Version Extension for FHIR R5:PlanDefinition.goal compared to FHIR R4
description: R5 `PlanDefinition.goal` maps as Equivalent to R4 `PlanDefinition.goal`

element.short: What the plan is trying to accomplish
element.definition: A goal describes an expected outcome that activities within the plan are intended to achieve. For example, weight loss, restoring an activity of daily living, obtaining herd immunity via immunization, meeting a process improvement objective, meeting the acceptance criteria for a test as specified by a quality specification, etc.
element.comment: R5 `PlanDefinition.goal` maps as Equivalent to R4 `PlanDefinition.goal`

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.definition: Unique id for the element within a resource (for internal references). This may be any string value that does not contain spaces.

slicing.description: Extensions are always sliced by (at least) url

element.definition: May be used to represent additional information that is not part of the basic definition of the element. To make the use of extensions safe and managable, there is a strict set of governance applied to the definition and use of extensions. Though any implementer can define an extension, there is a set of requirements that SHALL be met as part of the definition of the extension.
element.comment: There can be no stigma associated with the use of extensions by any application, project, or standard - regardless of the institution or jurisdiction that uses or defines the extensions.  The use of extensions is what allows the FHIR specification to retain a core level of simplicity for everyone.

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children
Must have either extensions or value[x], not both

element.short: identifies the meaning of the extension
element.definition: Source of the definition for the extension code - a logical name or a URL.
element.comment: The definition may point directly to a computable or human-readable definition of the extensibility codes, or it may be a logical URI as declared in some other specification. The definition SHALL be a URI for the Structure Definition defining the extension.

element.definition: Value of extension - must be one of a constrained set of the data types (see [Extensibility](extensibility.html) for a list).

constraint.human: All FHIR elements must have a @value or children

element.definition: Indicates a category the goal falls within.

element.short: Code or text describing the goal
element.definition: Human-readable and/or coded description of a specific desired objective of care, such as "control blood pressure" or "negotiate an obstacle course" or "dance with child at wedding".
element.comment: If no code is available, use CodeableConcept.text.

element.definition: Identifies the expected level of importance associated with reaching/sustaining the defined goal.
The event after which the goal should begin being pursued.
Identifies problems, conditions, issues, or concerns the goal is intended to address.

Didactic or other informational resources associated with the goal that provide further supporting information about the goal. Information resources can include inline text commentary and links to web resources.
Indicates what should be done and within what timeframe.

element.short: The parameter whose value is to be tracked
element.definition: The parameter whose value is to be tracked, e.g. body weight, blood pressure, or hemoglobin A1c level.

element.short: The target value to be achieved
element.definition: The target value of the measure to be achieved to signify fulfillment of the goal, e.g. 150 pounds or 7.0%, or in the case of pharmaceutical quality - NMT 0.6%, Clear solution, etc. Either the high or low or both values of the range can be specified. When a low value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or below the high value. Similarly, if the high value is missing, it indicates that the goal is achieved at any value at or above the low value.
element.comment: A CodeableConcept with just a text would be used instead of a string if the field was usually coded, or if the type associated with the goal.target.measure defines a coded value.

element.definition: Indicates the timeframe after the start of the goal in which the goal should be met.
